intro: Hylodesmum duclouxii, commonly known as the Ducloux's hylodesmum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within forest understories. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided lobes, contributing to its ornamental appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
